name: Donnie Landsman
statement_html:
Elected Experience: District 6105 Precinct Committee Officer, 2015-Present

Other Professional Experience: National Association of Parliamentarians- Present; BCRP By-Law Chairman 2017-18; BCRP Legislative District Chair 2015-16; ABATE of Washington Legislative Affairs Officer 2008-14.  Candidate for Richland City Council 2015.  Certified Airline Ramp and Operations Control Supervisor/Manager 1985-2005; Compliance Control Officer 2010-2014, Project Manager 2005-present.

Education: Hanford High School 1981; International Air Academy 1985.

Community Service: Bikers Collecting Coats; EPCC Teddy Bear Run; Olympia Toy Run; Food Drives; Volunteer Little League Coach; Youth Soccer Coach; 27 years Umpire

Statement:  Thank you for taking time to read my statement.  Most importantly,  I am asking that you take a few extra minutes to visit Donnie4Commmisioner.com before you mark your ballot.  Especially in this election, I believe you owe it to yourself to know my latest position on issues. 

Transparency, Accountability and Leadership are all traits that we want from our elected officials.  I believe that the County Commissioner District 1 representation has grown stagnant and is not in touch with the common citizen.  As a whole, the commission no longer is representative of those that placed them in office.  Decisions are being made without feasibility studies, cost analysis or public comment.  In many cases, the issues are hidden in the agenda to be voted on openly and secretively at the same time.  Effectively, the citizen has been marginalized. 

I entered this race because I am not a politician.  I am an American Worker who believes we deserve better than career politicians running our county.  Your vote is all that is needed to break the mold of a slick operator in a nice suit, or a long time elected official that has lost touch with the people. 
It Is time for change!
